item.title: Cross-Platform Shader Handling
item.description: When targeting all major mobile platforms and windows with a tiny team, writing all shaders for OpenGL ES3.x, D3D11 and Metal is a time consuming and error prone task. A desirable goal is to write shaders once and cross-compile or translate them for all target platforms. This article gives an overview over our current approach. Windows is my primary development platform, therefore shaders are written in HLSL for D3D11 first.
